line.left: subsequently entered the ermespu stream. our results do not contradict the possibility that offspring of brown_trout spawning in the baltic sea (landergren & vallin, 1998; limburg et al., 2001) may enter "non- natal" streams in less saline parts of the baltic sea where suitable spawning substrate and shelter against storms may be found. it is known that salmonids [e.g. atlantic salmon and brown_trout (e.g. klementsen et al., 2003; jonsson & jonsson, 2011)]; coho salmon, chinook salmon, sockeye salmon, steelhead
line.right: (e.g. hodge, wilzbach, duffy, quiñones, & hobbs, 2016; koski, 2009; roni et al., 2012; shrimpton et al., 2014; walsworth et al., 2015) and charrs e.g. dolly varden (e.g. armstrong, 1974; bond et al., 2014; hart, bond, may- mcnally, miller, & quinn, 2015) and arctic charr salvelinus_alpinus (e.g. klementsen et al., 2003) exhibit a vast array of life histories, which differ in duration of fresh- water and/or
